name: Yariely Hernandez
text:
Two words: unique and brilliant!
A fresh new light way to eat donuts!!
Nothing short of delicious and tasty!!!

name: Tanner Godfrey
text: Sons Donuts is amazing! They make your donut right in front of you! They have amazing flavor options including classics, seasonal and signature (fancy stuff). The donuts melt in your mouth and come with delicious dipping sauce. Super fun place to go and the pricing is reasonable! I will be visiting them again.

name: David Washburn
text: What a unique donut restaurant! Warm, flavored mini donuts with 'icings' like malted fudge, vanilla diplomat, cream cheese, or raspberry jam for dipping. My wife and I got two orders (8 donuts total: cinnamon-cardamom and PB-cocoa) but should have gotten the dozen. Delicious!

name: Mark Dean
text: Now I like donuts. Like... Have donuts on my socks, served donuts at my wedding like donuts. This place has a very interesting and entertaining twist on the donut. They serve mini donuts with dipping sauces. The donuts come in 4, 8, 12, or 24 orders with options for flavoring. They are made to order and hot when served. The donuts themselves are pretty good but what makes this place is the atmosphere. Indoor and outdoor seating and good music. This place is definitely going to turn into an Avondale staple! Welcome to the neighborhood Sons Donuts!

name: Mcbeardish
text:
Just go ahead and set this as your destination.

This place is SO GOOD! There are tons of great donuts out there and even more bad ones. And I’ve had them dozens of different ways. But NOBODY does them like this. Tiny, fluffy, delicate, full of flavor, little doughy rings of joy that you can dip in their absolutely killer sauces then inhale.

They fry them right in front of you, they spice them right in front of you, then they hand them to you and your tastebuds rejoice. It’s that simple.

These are special. This place is special. They care about the food and the experience and it shows. Quit reading this review and go put these donuts in your mouth.

But if you’re still unsure — and idk how you could be — then let me put it this way: if I could only chose one donut for the rest of my life... it would be these. And I’d cover them in the sauce. And I’d grab one of the flavored milks, strawberry is 🔥, and I’d live a happy life and die of a sugar coma.

If you’ve ever been to Pips Doughnuts in Portland, Oregon then you know how good these kind of donuts can be! And these are the only other mini donuts I’ve had that live up to Pips. And maybe even surpass it 👀. All they need now is some of that Candied Maple Bacon topping and id happily add a few more pounds to the waistline.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind words, Jake! That means so much to us!

name: Lynette Lang
text: Son’s Donuts catered late night donuts to our son & daughter-in law’s wedding, they were amazing! Everyone really enjoyed them & not one was left. They paired them with delicious sauces & glazes, wow, crazy good. Thank you Jim Watkins for your help, the donuts were a hit!

name: Chloea Farley
text: Visiting Birmingham and found this place before we left and I wish we had found it sooner! The fresh squeezed orange juice was the BEST!!! The variety of donuts and dipping sauces were delicious as well! Super friendly customer service and a great overall experience.

name: Jewel Cooper
text: Went here for the first time today; first off, the staff was very helpful & welcoming! The donuts are unique, light & tasty & the sauces compliment them well! I'll definitely be back

name: Mason VanSword
text: Completely different donut experience to what I was expecting/what already exists.  Like the concept of the mini donuts.  Coffee was ok, wish some of the "flavor shots" for milk could be incorporated into coffee to add flavors there.

name: David Hunter
text: First, I personally saw a worker drop a cleaning towel this morning, pick it up off the floor and use it again in the food prep area.  That alone turns me off.  In addition to that, don't expect a broad variety.  The donuts are MINI, but they are cooked right there in front of you on a little conveyer.  That made-to-order freshness is about the only really good thing because the coffee isn't great, and the prices are high.  I don't think I'll visit again.

name: Lauren Daley
text: Amazing, friendly staff and INCREDIBLE donuts. The bourbon old fashioned is a must have for anyone with taste. Will be buying from them again and again for years to come.

name: The Stylish Realtor
text: First time today and the experience was AWESOME!  Brandon was very friendly and knowledgeable with helping me to pick my sweet treats for today! Cant wait to come back.

name: Andy Mejia
text: Dear lord them donuts so good. Take it from a fat man that knows donuts. These are so good.

name: Kristen W.
text: The young guys who made our doughnuts were very nice! The doughnuts are cake-like, not yeasty but really delicious! The deep fry them fresh, roll them in a sugar or powder, and serve them with a sauce.

name: Łukasz Janyga
text: Been here 3 times in the past month. My favorite donuts by far! They have great coffee too!

name: Scott Gardner
text:
Can’t recall a time where I’ve ever been so disappointed by donuts. I’ve literally gone across the country trying new donut places, in search of the best one, so to say they’re a passion of mine is an understatement.  Given that, I was elated to find out about a new one coming to Birmingham to pair with our small but amazing lineup of donut spots. Having tried them today, Sons Donuts is absolutely in the bottom tier (below Heavenly, Hero, even Donut Joes/Grateful) and more on par with YoYo. Giving them 3 stars because that’s about the floor for rating a donut place.

They’re served in packs of four, which is common for mini-donut places, but you can’t mix and match. Only one type of donut per pack, which literally goes against the reason they were invented.  Maybe go here with a large group of people so you can actually try a variety. Overall the batter is more old school and ended up bring dry. Then the toppings didn’t cover the full donuts, which made the dryness more prevalent. Positives - Donuts were hot, vibe was great, employees were nice, but overall there’s not a lot to recommend here.

resp.text: Thanks for your feedback, Scott. We're sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy your visit. We certainly understand the desire to do 4 different flavors in a 4 count of mini donuts, but it would be not be practical for us from a logistics standpoint, particularly since each flavor option has a dipping sauce pairing. This is a common practice for mini donut shops. I am so sorry that you felt your donuts were unsatisfactory. Certainly we were still working through some kinks on our grand opening weekend, and I hate that it sounds like you didn't get our best. Thanks again for sharing your thoughts, hope you'll give us another try sometime.

name: Lillis Taylor
text: At first I was disappointed that I had to buy 8 donuts to be able to try more than one flavor, but in talking to the owner I got happily swept up in the enthusiasm and went for it. Felt a little pricey at first, but the experience and taste were worth it. Here's the deal: you've got Krispy Kreme when it's about quantity over quality. As with other boutique dessert experiences, the higher price affords other amenities...it's called a treat for a reason in my book. Welcome to the neighborhood, Sons!

resp.text: Thanks for the thoughtful review, Lillis! We're glad you enjoyed your visit!

name: Michael Mickens
text: "They're grrreat!"

text: Really, really good. Good people. Good donuts. Had the Carter, Levi, and Old Fashion Glazed. All excellent.

resp.text: Thanks, Chris! We're glad you enjoyed!

name: Iris Kołtuniak
text: I LOVED Sons Donuts! The concept is super cool and unique, and the donuts are made to order with seasonal and amazing flavors, and they are so so delicious!!!

name: Martin Santana
text: Bit expensive for what they are. Love their house souce.

name: Bill Middleton
text: Donuts are good. $5 for 4 little donuts is pricey though. I won't be able to afford to come here often.

name: Agila Elfallah
text:
I saw some of their advertisements on Instagram and decided to try it out. This place is fantastic. The staff was super enthusiastic and knowledgeable of their product, which is always a good sign. They recommended me a few flavors and dipping sauces and they did not disappoint. The actual location is great. Small, but still a nice place to take your family for a treat.
Now real mini donuts are not the same as your regular sized ones, so don't expect it to taste like krispy kreme. They are a little more dry, but thats what you want because they have amazing dipping sauces that were the big stars of the show. I got The Fisher and The Jude for mine and I highly recommend them.
Also saw they were opened until 10 on weekends, so not a bad treat to grab if you're out having a good time in Avondale. I'll definitely be back with friends so I can brag about being the first one of us to try it.

name: Kevin Cosma
text:
Very different donut. But, they have some things that need to work on for sure.

So, today we purchased a box of half a dozen of each variety.
But, when we got it home, we were unaware of which dip goes with each donut.
There needs to be some labeling on the little cups they give you with the icing or dip.

resp.text:
Hi Kevin,

Thanks for the feedback, we appreciate it. We're only a week in, so we're definitely still trying to figure certain things out. This is definitely a subject we've discussed, but have not found a solution to yet. Because of the sheer volume of to-go sauces we use for our orders(probably 90% of our orders are to-go), labeling each individual cup would be a challenge. We don't know the solution yet, but we understand it's not ideal and we hope to improve on that. Regardless, we hope you enjoyed the donuts! Thanks again for sharing your feedback, it's helpful.

text: One of the vendors at my office brought two dozen mixed donuts for us. I have to admit that this was the first time that I actually ate donuts that a vendor brought in and didn't feel guilty at all because the donuts were so good. They were by far the best tasting donuts I have ever had!

name: Pat Moore

name: Nicholas Blackstock
text:
I'm not even a big sweets guy but I WILL be frequenting this don't shop for sure!

As mentioned, typically I'm not the one to crave ice cream, cake or donuts. I usually just don't. Even when purchasing donuts (or grabbing free ones for that matter) I always go for plain glaze. I've had other eclectic flavors and styles but they usually don't do anything for me. All that being said to say, I now crave sweets and it's because of these donuts!

Check my pics to see some of the variety that have. From fruity pebbles, to old fashion, to blueberry cake donuts they are all so tasty... It blows my mind. They can only get better with time too, which is scary but exciting. I'm sure there are flavors that are being fine tuned (the owner told me so) that weren't even out when I went. If and when you go, you MUST... MUST... MUST get the maple bacon donut! It's soooo good!

Coffee provided by O'Henry's is the perfect touch. I prefer the Jamaican Me Crazy blend, but there's a house blend as well. Oh, almost forgot... A couple of great breakfast sandwiches on deck as well (there were samples when I went). Both wrapped in baked donut dough!

Long Review Short... Visit this donut shop TODAY if only for the maple bacon! You won't regret it

resp.text: Thanks Nick! Come back soon!

text: None of the donuts were very good. Some had a burnt taste, others were greasy. The flavor of the cream was very bland. Out of a dozen we ended up throwing away 8, and they were too expensive compared to other shops. Go to Heavenly Donuts instead, they are amazing everytime.

text: Got a chance to stop by the new Daylight Donuts on Acton Road this morning en route to work. So glad I did! Chose the a maple bacon doughnut and a cup of O'Henry's southern pecan coffee. Those flavors are amazing together, let me tell you. Even a little reminiscent of fall (the best season ever). The staff were really friendly and approachable, the store was open and light and clean. I would definitely go back - for only $3.58 I got a really tasty breakfast treat!

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words - we are really glad you enjoyed your visit! Come back soon!

name: Tony Tom
text: We saw this place on our way to the soccer field. Past Saturday I took the whole family to daylight donuts. Looked like a small family owned place. My daughter ordered 2 donuts chocolate glazed with sprinkles and my son ordered 2 chocolate glazed. My husband got a peach pic and I got a pinecone. 2 staff members one with shorter hair one with longer. They checked us out and we went outside with our box. We saw that they gave us one sprinkle donut but charged us for 2. Then I found a hair in my pinecone. I went back and they had already put away the donuts. However I quietly showed the lady with short hair. That there is a hair in my breakfast. Her reply was" well these things happen" no they do not just happen someone is not careful enough while baking and cooking. She replaced my breakfast however by that time I was done. it would have been a great place if they paid attention to their work and not rush to pack up for the day. We went around 9:40am

resp.text:
We are so sorry you didn't have a great experience with us. Please contact me by email so we can make this right. My email address is magiccitychris@gmail.com, or you can submit your information through our website: magiccitydough.com

Thank you for making us aware of this and I hope to hear from you soon.

Chris

name: Lindi Pearson
text: This place has extremely slow service and not the best doughnuts. My kids love them though. The employees are friendly just pretty slow which is a pain when you are in a hurry on a Saturday morning

name: Hope Ryder
text:
My family has loved the Daylight Donuts on Valleydale for the last 7+ years. The service has always been great and we rarely, if ever, have any complaints. So we know what their typical level of service is. We were beyond psyched to see they were opening up a new location on Acton Rd, which is now closer to my mom's house. We have been to the Acton location many times over the past year and a half, thinking we'd have a similar experience to the Valleydale location. I'm so disappointed to say that EVERY single time I've gone, as well as all other family members, we've had a horrible experience! Overall, the customer service is terrible. The employees do not listen or don't pay attention to what you want or what you actually get. For example, this morning we went thru the drive thru. There was no one in line and no one in the store. We ordered 2 dozen glazed holes and 6 regular glazed. Easy enough, right?! We thought so.. But apparently not. We got the holes but when we got home and opened up the box, I couldn't believe it! Not one single regular glazed donut was in the box!! There was a chocolate covered, chocolate with sprinkles, a custard filled chocolate covered donut, sour cream, strawberry sour cream and blueberry cake donut! It seemed like we got someone else's order but no one else was there! When I tried to call the store, their answering machine picked up after several rings, so I left a message. After receiving such poor service, I can't even immediately speak to anyone about it!! It is impossible to understand how these 2 locations share the same name. That's the only thing they have in common. I
We've also been incorrectly and outrageously charged during another trip. They charged us over $30 when the correct total was no more than $15. This wasn't the first time we've been given the wrong items. My sister and mom went during a slow time. No other customers were there in the drive thru or inside. They ordered a dozen assorted donuts and 2 large coffees. The girl ended up handed them 2 big boxes of donuts and a large and medium coffee. Then proceeded to charge them a price that was way more than what they had ordered. My sister told the girl they hadn't received the right order and gave the boxes back. After a while of waiting, they were given another box of donuts. However, they were still being charged the same price as before for the 2 dozen donuts, even though they'd given 1 box back, that they never even ordered to begin with. My sister had to explain to her that they'd given the second dozen back and that they only ordered one dozen. Eventually she corrected the total. But after all that, they didn't even bother addressing the wrong coffee size they received. When they got home, of course the order wasn't right. They had 2 chances to correct the order and still failed. That's ridiculous! We have not had a single good trip to this location. Most visits have been during extremely slow times when no other customers were at Daylight. It doesn't make sense how it's consistently so awful when they're only taking care of 1 customer.
In addition, the donuts we have had there do not taste nearly as good as what we've had at the other location. That is not just my opinion. Several other family members have said the same.
We've given this location more than enough attempts to get better so we do not intend to return, except to get our money back for our wrong order today. We'll stick to the Valleydale Daylight and I recommend the same to others!

resp.text: Hope, we are so sorry for the experiences you have had at our Acton Rd location. What you have described is definitely not what we are wanting our customers to experience when you visit us. If you would please contact me via email at magiccitychris@gmail.com, we would love to get some more information from you to try to make this right. I hope to hear from you soon. Again, very sorry for the experience you had today.

name: cottonwood rescue
text:
Dunkin' let me tell y’all about the team at 1865 E. Main St. Dothan😍 This team is always the most friendly and helpful I have ever experienced at Dunkin’💯 & I have visited them from Panama City Beach to Tallahassee, to Birmingham to Gainesville & no other compares to my home store!🤞🏼As an Emt I’m on the go with 911 ALL day & believe me we are blazing the roads all day to and from the hospital. & I know if I need a pick me up I will only stop at this location. They know how to get my coffee fix prompt and exactly how I like it. 90% of the time they see me pull up on the ambulance and they already have my order going before I make it in the store! I know they have to be tired of seeing me but they always greet me with a smile on their faces! I couldn’t ask for better service and great personalities!  It’s the “Be safe out there today.” For me! 🥲 Y’all are just as essential as I am and I thank y’all for your service!  & keep being great!☺️

With much love always!💕☕️

- a very great full EMT🚑💙

They said I ordered a hot drink but I have NEVER in my life ordered a hot drink, I only drink cold so that was wrong on their part. My coffee didn't have the shot of espresso I paid for and the drink made me sick for 5 hours after drinking it. Idk if they tried to poison me or what out of retaliation of having to make another drink. :( I work right across the street so I was so excited but now I'm incredibly sad and disappointed.

name: Little Micchelle
text: When this Dunkin first opened I was extremely excited. Its right across from my job and it was a welcome addition to the area. But in the 3 times i've ordered from there every time it has been a struggle to get a simple powdered donut. I have eaten at Dunkins in many states. My family and I have driven 60 miles to get a dozen donuts from a Dunkin we know to be a good one. Today the lady at the window said I couldn't get a powdered donut because they are seasonal! What season is a powdered donut for? I was planning on frequenting this establishment but if i'm going to be outright lied to and denied items I know should be available I would rather drive across town to the krispy kreme.

text:
I'm sorry to be the sour note for what seems to be a well-loved donut shop, but... I found these donuts to be disgusting. They were big, and pretty, sure, but the glaze/frosting used on them is overpoweringly, sickly sweet and absolutely reeks of coconut. Even getting near the box sitting on the counter and you get hit in the face with this coconut-y smell. And they're not coconut donuts. I don't know what they use to make the glaze, but it's terrible.

The store itself was clean and the woman who took my order was nice and helpful, and they throw in free donuts and donut holes, but... free stuff is only a bonus if you can eat it, and after a donut and a couple of donut holes, I just didn't want any more.

text:
This place is worth the drive. She threw in an extra donut and a handful of donut holes with my order. The steak eggroll is a must try!

Be aware, the new location is 1 mile north of the old location just past McDonald's on the left side of the road. Google maps took me to the old address.

name: Caroline Graham Craig
text: Yummy scratch-made donuts!  They have a variety of flavors.

name: Ben Smallwood
text: Best Donuts I've ever ate and they have the greatest Food invented which is a Cheese Steak Eggroll. Make sure to call ahead for the Egg Rolls.

name: Ashley Snell
text: Awesome little place. They have a Philly cheese steak egg roll. Pineapple fritters, red velvet cake doughnuts, and much much more.

name: Dusty Patrick

text: Excellent service and doughnuts! I ordered a dozen doughnuts. The kind woman at the front counter helped me pick them out and even gave me some doughnut holes for free. The doughnuts were great and the service was awesome. Please support this small business that does kind things like this for random customers.

text: The sweetest people making equally sweet donut treats. Apple Fritters are amazing!

name: Frank Duncan
text: Really good donuts and an excellent variety to choose from. The Apple fritter is the best! Cinnamon rolls are also excellent. And for fresh homemade donuts, the prices are very reasonable. Visiting family in the area from five states away so this was my first visit. Would definitely return here if I lived in the area. I bought a dozen and didn't know this but evidently when you buy a dozen donuts they throw in a dozen holes! And those were my daughter's favorite so everyone was happy!

name: Aubrey Elting
text: Great donuts and service. Great hot items as well.

name: Bill Wood
text: Sometimes its better just to open a box of donuts that someone brings in without actually seeing where they came from. It wasnt the cleanest, most professional looking place. The man working was friendly. The place had a funky smell to it as well. The donuts were good, but after seeing the inside of the place, i was a little hesitant to eat them.

name: JOLEY YARBROUGH
text: Great little donut shop, with a good variety made freash daily. Her cheese steak eggrolls are awesome. Kids love the donuts.

name: Senior Living Guide
text: The best donuts around.  The lady who runs this place is super sweet and usually trows in a few extra donut holes. The donuts are to die for. I love these with a good cup of coffee. Highly recommend this place.

name: Lori Jones
text: Google says they are permanently closed but they are DEFINITELY OPEN(7 days a week)  & are NOT closing!! I went this morning. Best Donuts I can find in the Huntsville area! Great people! P.S. She ALWAYS throws in free donut holes! Getchu some!

text: Some of the best prices around with friendly people and great tasting donuts and pastries. Highly recommend.

name: bandrmitchell

text: We love the donuts and the Owner is so sweet. We love home town donut shops! We get donuts every weekend! Also try K-May’s FAMOUS PHILLY EGG ROLLS, you will NOT be sorry. If she doesn’t have any made she will make you one. We love this place. Not the cleanest place but always good donuts and wonderful conversation.

Guess I will let everyone else go and let me know what they think since going as much as I would like is not on the 2019 plan. Lol enjoy!

text: Super good donuts, but here are three insider tips you must try: Pineapple fritters, jalepeno kolaches, and the Philly Cheese Steak Egg Rolls.  You can thank me later.  LOL

text: Or family favorite. This donut shop is family-owned and operated. The staff are sweet and love engaging my kids. If you bring your small children in with you, be prepared to take home a few freebies-- when I have the kiddos in tow I can usually anticipate an extra donut or dozen donut holes. Sweet donuts, sweeter people! :)

name: Kay Campbell
text: These donuts are fried in coconut oil, so they're practically health food! Plus, they're super yummy. I especially recommend the Apple fritters. Succulent, with a terrific tangled batter kind of texture that makes them a blast to pull apart.

Try the blueberry donut!

text: I grew up with dunkin doughnuts 42 years dunkin has been a bench mark by which i judged all other places by  .. i purchased 2 dozen assorted doughnuts and fritters... i liked the fritters not so the doughnuts but everyone else that ate any loved them... ill go back and see if it was just me and ill try their ""pigs in a blanket  """  be careful the delightful lady behind the counter will try to sell you everything in the display case...lol

name: Bob SoloMan
text:
5:00 PM - in the mood to take home a couple donuts for the wife and kid. Store was not trashed, but trashy. I know it's just a donut shop - but hey... if the front looks this crappy, what's the back look like?
The donut employee (probably family of owner or owner) took a minute to get up and leave her boyfriend (hanging out or working, couldn't tell) to ask me what I wanted.
There wasn't much left - so I took some holes and a couple mixed glazed and cinnamon  sugar coated.

They weren't 1/10th as good as they are at another location at 6:45am when I get them. The Jordan Lane store, in the morning is off the hook good. This store may have the same taste that early but I don't think I'll ever go back at 5pm or after breakfast hours since they make donuts in the AM and let em sit all day.

5pm-6pm (closing) should be half price donuts.

name: Cavana Faithwalker
text:
This K-May Donuts are awesome.  K-May is a very very unassuming place.  The first time I walked in years ago I thought, "Oh my gosh, should I leave?!"  I keep going back and back over the years.
It must be a franchise since there are other K-Mays (Donuts and Doughnuts) around.  I haven't visited those.  The taste of the donuts at this location is amazing and unique.  I think I could pick them out of a line-up. A must taste experience for donut lovers.   Well worth driving past Krispy Kreme or Dunkin Donuts with this shop in the area.  They don't have cream filled Long Johns which I should suggest.
Friendly fast service.
They have a few breakfast things I've not tasted.  Buy milk, soda, energy drinks, etc.  Easy plentiful parking. Cash or credit accepted.

text: I just stopped there today 11-9-18. They open 8am-2pm. Their phone has changed I didn't think to write it down. The donuts and fritters are great but the cheesecake egg rolls are awesome. Try them out.

name: Cardelia Howell-Diamond
text: Today I had my first encounter with K-May's  Donuts. It will not be the last! This place is fantastic. The worker were very personable, the location well maintained and the apple fritter to die for!!! Run, don't walk ASAP and enjoy them immediately.

name: Catherine Brodnick
text: These are the best donuts my family has ever had! And we are donut connoisseurs. We haven't had one that wasn't amazing yet! And you get a ton of donuts for your money. Go, go, go! You won't regret it.

name: Will Faulkenberry
text: Have visited here many times. Donuts are delicious! Wanted to treat my daughter's teachers to Donuts. I checked ahead of time and and their sign in the window said they open up at 4 a.m. So got up in the freezing weather, warmed up my vehicle and got out at 6 a.m. When I arrive, lights are off, no one's there, closed. Very disappointed.

name: Stephanie Newton
text: This place has amazing donuts!  First of all, they are huge. Second, they have a unique flavor that is long overdue. The texture is great and doesnt just melt in your mouth like others. I love the variety of options. They have a steak and cheese eggroll that is really good also. I got a free one on my first visit. They also include a few free donut holes with your purchase. The staff is so friendly! :) This is definitely my new favorite donut place!

text: Donuts are the best. However, you never know if they will be open. Several times make the drive to find it closed , when sign hours say they should be open. Terrible business practice.😕

Their doughnut holes are the best I have ever had.if you want a doughnut and are on 53 you must stop by here. If you love your family stop by and get a dozen then you will probably be fighting over who gets the last one. A great family owned business, so introduce yours to theirs.

text: I hardly ever have an issue with the Vestavia location, but they need to work on their customer service. Especially when they are getting the orders wrong. They are there to make the coffee and make the orders right for the customers, so they shouldn't get mad at us when the order is wrong. Also when you hand a customer a drink you should hand them a straw to go with it and not get mad when they sit there and ask for a straw. Just some things to think about.

I didnt catch it till i received the one drink with both in it. I then had to purchase another one so atleast one would be correct which wasnt that big of a deal but she didnt offer to fix it.

name: Lindsay Ellinas
text:
Very pleased to have this new location, ESPECIALLY because the staff is INCREDIBLE.
I'm also extremely thankful that they are continuing to adhere to the Covid-19 health guidelines, with everyone wearing masks and gloves, and touchless drive thru.

Thank you for holding steady at this location.

name: notthebeesxoxo
text:
This is the best DD in town. I love DD coffee but struggled for a while to find a DD that can consistently make a drink right. Every place, they either made it too strong, not strong enough, not sweet enough, too sweet... Just tons of issues and lots of wasted money on coffees I couldn't even force myself to finish.

Then they opened this location and they are the most consistent DD I've been to and I go here every single day during the week. The people are also so nice and the drive thru, even when busy, is so fast! There could be 7 cars in line and I'll still be done in 10 mins or less.

text: I wish I could reply to the fellow reviewers on Google without leaving a review myself as I have never been there. I’d like to reply to Jay Carroll. To leave a 1 star review because they had little to choose from.. is kind of not helpful. You leave a one star review if the service was horrible or if you found a hair in your food. Donut shops can run out of donuts but that doesn’t mean it’s bad. It’s good for the business. So instead of hating on them, maybe come at an earlier time because literally all donut business run low on downs towards noon. Please use some common sense.

name: T O
text: What I love about these donuts is that they are sweet on the outside but not too sweet on the inside- you have to try one of their glazed donuts to understand! There is a large assortment to try from glazed, iced sprinkles (pink, blue, chocolate, etc.), sour cream crullers, cake donuts, powdered sugar covered donuts, cream/lemon/raspberry filled, and it goes on.  I can’t forget their kolaches which are very delish! The store is very clean which is a big plus for me. The customer service is always polite and courteous whenever I go! I will attach pics.  Enjoy.

name: Like A Sir
text:
It's absolutely amazing how often they're out of one thing or another. Apple fritters? Don't even bother. They're always out.

And if they run out of donut holes they resort to cutting up plain glazed donuts and selling the chunks to you without bothering to mention it. Contrary to what whoever decided that was ok thinks, the donut holes and the glazed donuts are two different things. I actually personally don't care for the plain glazed donuts, so when I order donut holes, that's what I want. If you're out, just tell me you're out. Unfortunately, I'm very, very used to it at this point.

On the positive side of things, most of the staff are quite friendly, and there are days when they actually put forth effort towards making you happy when they're out of something. I wish I had gotten the name of the awesome girl that served me on one of the days they were out of apple fritters (but were willing to make some, which most of the time they won't bother). She checked on me several times, offered me a free drink, etc. I declined the extras, but just the bit of EFFORT made all the difference. Only reason this is a 3 star review instead of two.

name: Emily Joyner
text: I really love Krispy Kreme. This one is really nice. I love the design of the interior. It's very modern and clean. All the staff were absolute sweethearts. I'll definitely be back, and not just because their donuts are my weakness.

name: Mike Carreca
text: The doughnuts were to die for , but the service is absolutely terrible. And the manager didn't seem to care.  Maybe ha can't find anyone who cares about doing a good job. Unfortunately,  as being a disabled,  retired person,  I have operated several companies and know this truth all too well. Ever since they opened,  each time I have visited,  i have stood in line more than 15 minutes watching workers moving around, but, not doing anything. I guess the doughnuts are worth the wait.

text: Went for Valentine’s Day donuts for work. I left my house 15 minutes early in an attempt to grab them and be at work on time. They were completely unprepared for the holiday rush. I chose the drive through instead of the inside counter due to the number of people that were there. 45 minutes later, I was still sitting in a non moving drive through line and called my employee so she could go to Dunkin’.By the time I finally got out of the drive through line without donuts, it was at an hour wait and  my employee was back at the office with fresh Dunkin’ Donuts five minutes after I managed to make it to work. It was extremely disappointing and if they didn’t plan well, they could have communicated with waiting customers if they needed to make more donuts. I have no plans to return.

The staff wasn't really nice, not ride, but they seemed annoyed by the customers. Recently my kids really wanted to go a couple times and the donuts were awesome. The staff was all different and very nice. So maybe they just needed a few months to get the hang of it.

name: LaQuetta Lane
text: They rarely have hot donuts. I wait so long just for cold donuts. I literally have to ask are they got while I'm ordering and if they are not I turn around.

resp.text:
Hi LaQuetta - we're sorry about your experience. There is a limited amount of time that we make hot Original Glazed doughnuts, since there is separate production time needed for our filled, iced and decorated varieties. At our shop the hours when we make hot Original Glazed are Sun-Sat 6:00 AM-11:00 AM, Sun-Thu 4:00 PM-9:00 PM
and Fri,Sat 4:00 PM-11:00 PM. We hope the hours posted here help you with planning your next trip. Thank you for your feedback!

name: Rachel Skipworth
text: I like the fact Auburn finally has a Krispy Kreme, but I am extremely disappointed with their staff and the constant running out of doughnuts.  The staff needs to learn to pay attention to what the customer is telling them when ordering and making sure the right product is given to the customer.  Also, I went to Krispy Kreme two different times to get apple fritter doughnuts and one of their specialty drinks.  They were out both times.  This is a new store, so I do not understand how they can already be out of product they are supposed to have.  Also, I have been given the wrong order twice.  Pay attention people!

name: Lynn Wray Dillard (Alabama Creeks)
text:
Yes, these are 5-STAR donuts. This is a family owned local institution that has been in the Shoals area forever. Sweet friendly folks greet you and they are honestly happy to wait on you. Opens early at 4am serving fresh donuts until 2pm. They sleep-in on Sundays and don't open until 5am!  They do a lot of business so expect a limited selection after noon. There is a drive-thru.

National donut chains can't touch 'em.
